channel.title: My custom dragon model (start)
channel.description:
well i figured since im wanting to get better at this modeling stuff i might as well start making a npc, so ive started on my first npc! its gunna be a low poly dragon well hopefully low as i can make it haha. its not much so far but i mean for like 20 minutes of work i think its starting out pretty good so far im worried about when i get to adding legs and stuff but i'll get through it :p well tell me what you think so far and any tips i'd love it thanks.
so i scratched the old model because i felt i was losing the "low poly" part of the model. so i restarted this time i feel it really represents "low poly". once again leave your opinions below! thanks! and also i will be making it low poly then slowing working may way up making it more and more detailed
[IMG]http://i1251.photobucket.com/albums/hh555/wthsquids/Photobucket%20Desktop%20-%20ALEX-PC/fca1d223.jpg[/img]
wireframe first: [IMG]http://i1251.photobucket.com/albums/hh555/wthsquids/Photobucket%20Desktop%20-%20ALEX-PC/2908305b.jpg[/img]
wireframe again but changed the top a lil: [IMG]http://i1251.photobucket.com/albums/hh555/wthsquids/Photobucket%20Desktop%20-%20ALEX-PC/531dff96.jpg[/img]
before i changed it: [IMG]http://i1251.photobucket.com/albums/hh555/wthsquids/Photobucket%20Desktop%20-%20ALEX-PC/51747c16.jpg[/img]

item.title: My custom dragon model (start)
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:

the elve age:

Keep it up! It’s really improving; looking nice!

Looking forward to see your end result!

item.title: My custom dragon model (start)
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

noo haha i just made that half then i mirrored it and scaled it so it fits nice ima post another pic sometime but yea its just a learning experience i thought it would be fun

Read full topic

item.title: My custom dragon model (start)
item.dc:creator: @dd123c5 dd123c5
item.description:
@dd123c5 wrote:

not that i am this super modeler or anything but i would suggjest makeing only half of a dragon that you just mirror it on the other side save you half the time and makes it look nicer cuse from what it looks like you doing is that you just going to build the whole thing buy hand both side and all so good luck

Read full topic

item.title: My custom dragon model (start)
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Try getting a reference picture and going off of that, it makes things a lot easier. Also only mark points that are necessary, if you make them all it won’t be low poly.

Read full topic

item.title: My custom dragon model (start)
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

Good luck i hope it works out for, if not it will still be a learning experience. Keep updating so we can see your progress.

Read full topic
